ua.net.freecode.chart
Class Chart

java.lang.Object
  com.vaadin.ui.AbstractComponent
      ua.net.freecode.chart.impl.ChartComponent
          ua.net.freecode.chart.Chart
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.vaadin.event.MethodEventSource, com.vaadin.terminal.Paintable, com.vaadin.terminal.Sizeable, com.vaadin.terminal.VariableOwner, com.vaadin.ui.Component, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, ChartEngine.ChartChangeListener
public class Chart
extends ChartComponent

It is the main class, which you instantiate once for each chart on the web page. Chart is Vaadin Component, so you can add it to any panel, layout or window.
It also contains a lot of methods to customize the chart.
Example:
Chart chart1 = new Chart();
leftPanel.addComponent(chart1);

See Also:
Serialized Form

setDisabledWholeChart

public void setDisabledWholeChart(boolean disabled)
Disables or enables the whole chart (except the general title). The function can be useful if you are going to use this library as a d3 wrapper, which allows to draw any pictures dynamically. If you do not need even the title, see the setDisabledGeneralCaption function.

Parameters:
disabled - true for disabling, false for enabling

setCustomMarkerShape

public void setCustomMarkerShape(int number,
                                 java.lang.String svgPathD)
You can create your own marker shapes.

Parameters:
number - the custom number of the shape: 0..239
svgPathD - the path description of the shape use the HTML5 standard for SVG PATH D parameter, for example: "m -3 0 l 6 3 l 0 -6 Z" Consider that at the beginning the cursor is set to the center of the marker. If you create a custom shape with number 5, for example, you can later use it by creating new Marker(5);

setCurvePresentationDefault

public void setCurvePresentationDefault(CurvePresentation curvePresentation)
Sets the presentation for each series in cases when a specific presentation is not set for this series.

Parameters:
curvePresentation - the presentation of the series, which includes the curve kind (line, single points, bars, area), the thickness and the marker shape.

addExecutableJavascript

public int addExecutableJavascript(java.lang.String javascript)
Adds a javascript to be executed to draw a picture. It can be any javascript or even javascript function. It will be reexecuted each time, when the chart is updated in any way. The javascript will be repeatedly executed each time when the chart is redrawn. If you do not need repeated execution, consider method addExecutableJavascriptToRunOnce

Parameters:
javascript - any valid javascript.
The main purpose of this library is d3 wrapping.
Example of the relevant javascript:
d3.select(".chart1 g.chart-data-box-low").append("path").attr("d","M 300 230 l 0 -200 a 200 200 0 0 1 173.2 300 Z").attr("fill","blue").attr("stroke","#FFFFFF").attr("stroke-width",1).attr("stroke-linejoin","round")
Returns:
the assigned id of this javascript, which can be used for deleting it from the pool.

addExecutableJavascriptToRunOnce

public void addExecutableJavascriptToRunOnce(java.lang.String javascript)
Adds a javascript to be executed to draw a picture. It can be any javascript or even javascript function. It will be reexecuted each time, when the chart is updated in any way. The javascript will be executed only once. If you need repeated execution in case of chart redrawing, consider method addExecutableJavascript

Parameters:
javascript - any valid javascript.
The main purpose of this library is d3 wrapping.
Example of the relevant javascript:
d3.select(".chart1 svg").append("text").text("Faith").attr("x",400).attr("y",190).attr("fill","yellow").attr("style","font-size:14px")

clearAllExecutableJavascript

public void clearAllExecutableJavascript()
deletes all executable javascripts in the pool, which are reexecuted in case of chart redrawing, added with the addExecutableJavascript function

deleteExecutableJavascript

public void deleteExecutableJavascript(int javascriptId)
Deletes a javascript from the pool, so it will not be re-executed any longer in case of chart redrawing, added by function addExecutableJavascript

Parameters:
javascriptId - the id assigned by addExecutableJavascript function.

public int addExtraMessageUntilNextChartRedrawing(java.lang.String message,
                                                  java.lang.String cssClassName,
                                                  ChartPosition position,
                                                  Chart.Alignment alignment)
Adds additional message to the chart. The message will be removed when the chart is redrawn next time. This is just for temporary messages.

Parameters:
message - the text of the message
cssClassName - the css class name (or empty string)
position - the position where the message should be printed
alignment - the alignment
Returns:
the id of the message which can be used for deleting it

setLegendPlace

public void setLegendPlace(Chart.LegendPlace place,
                           ChartPosition position)
Sets the place and position of the legend. If you specify the place as Top, Bottom, Left or Right, a special space is allocated from the whole chart area. If you specify the place as Overlap, no special space is allocated for the legend, it is placed over other parts of the chart.

Parameters:
place - the place can be Top, Bottom, Left, Right, Overlap
position - specifies exact coordinates. If the place is Top or Bottom, the y coordinate is determined automatically and only x coordinate is taken from the position you specified. If the place is Left or Right, the x coordinate is determined automatically and only y coordinate is taken from the position you specified. If the place is Overlap, both x and y from the position are used to put the legend.

setLegendWidthClearance

public void setLegendWidthClearance(int clearance)
Sets the clearance (horizontal size) for the total space occupied by the legend

Parameters:
clearance - the width clearance in pixels

margin - the margin in pixels

setPopUpValueIndicatorAlignmentForEachRow

public void setPopUpValueIndicatorAlignmentForEachRow(Chart.Alignment[] alignment)
Sets the alignment for each row in the message shown on the pop-up value indicator.

Parameters:
alignment - the alignment

setPopUpValueIndicatorFormat

public void setPopUpValueIndicatorFormat(java.lang.String format)
Sets the format of the message shown at the pop-up value indicator.

Parameters:
format - the format of the message including any characters. Use the following format specifiers: %l the title of the current series used in the legend %X the x-value of the current point %Y the y-value of the current point %x the x-coordinate on the screen %y the y-coordinate on the screen %n the line break, that is, the next part will be shown at the next row The default is as follows: %l%n%X: %Y

setPopUpValueIndicatorVisibilityRadiusXWeight

public void setPopUpValueIndicatorVisibilityRadiusXWeight(float weight)
The pop-up value indicator appears for the point with the smallest radius, which is calculated by the formula: Visibility Radius = square root of ( RadiusXWeight * x^2 + y^2) Note: if you change this value, consider also changing the value by function setPopUpValueIndicatorVisibilityRadius(float radius)

Parameters:
weight, - the RadiusXWeight in this formula, the default is 2.

setPopUpValueIndicatorVisibilityRadius

public void setPopUpValueIndicatorVisibilityRadius(float radius)
Sets the visibility radius. See also the description of function setPopUpValueIndicatorVisibilityRadiusXWeight(float weight). If no point is found within the ellipse with the visibility radius, the pop-up value indicator disappears.

Parameters:
radius - the maximum visibility radius.

setAxisCaptionWidth

public void setAxisCaptionWidth(int width)
Sets the default space allocated for axis caption. This value can be overriden for a specific AxisSystem.

Parameters:
width - the width in pixels.

setAxisLabelNumericWidth

public void setAxisLabelNumericWidth(int width)
Sets the space allocated for axis labels in case they are represented in numbers (not strings in general).

Parameters:
width - the width in pixels.

setAxisLabelStringWidth

public void setAxisLabelStringWidth(int width)
Sets the space allocated for axis labels in case they are represented by strings in general (not numbers only).

Parameters:
width - the width in pixels.

setLegendItemWidth

public void setLegendItemWidth(int width)
Set the width for each legend item. This is very important function and consider setting its value in case of changing the text of any legend items. The width is set the same for all legend items.

Parameters:
width - the width in pixels.

updateChart

public void updateChart()
Updates the chart area (redraws the chart area). This method is called automatically when it is necessary, so normally there is no need to call it manually.
